contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Posen kr Schwerin.jpg|thumb|right]] '''Kreis Schwerin in Posen''' ({{lang-pl|Powiat [[Skwierzyna|skwierzyński]]}}) was a [[Districts of Prussia|county]] in Prussia, first in the southern administrative [[Posen (region)|Region of Posen]] within the Prussian [[Province of Posen]] (till 1920), then within the [[Posen-West Prussia|Province of the Frontier March of Posen-West Prussia]] (till 1 October 1938) and at last as part of the administrative [[Frankfurt (region)|Region of Frankfurt]] within the [[Province of Brandenburg]] (till 1945). It presently lies in the western part of [[Poland|Polish]] region of [[Lubuskie Voivodeship]]. ==History== The county was formed in 1887 from parts of the [[Kreis Birnbaum]]. After the [[First World War]] Kreis Schwerin and few more counties belonged to the truncated rest of the Province of Posen remaining with the [[Free State of Prussia]], [[Weimar Republic|Germany]]. Together with [[Kreis Bomst]] and [[Kreis Meseritz]] the Kreis Schwerin formed a western territorial [[exclave]] of Posen-West Prussia. The county's capital [[Skwierzyna|Schwerin in Posen]] (now Skwierzyna), thus distinguished from [[Schwerin|Schwerin in Mecklenburg]], started being rather distinguished as Schwerin upon [[Warta|Warthe]] by the river its is located on, which is why also the county was referred to as Kreis Schwerin (Warthe). When Posen-West Prussia province was dissolved in 1938 the bulk of its territory, anyway neighbouring [[Province of Pomerania (1815–1945)|Pomerania]], was annexed to that province, whereas its western exclave became part of the Province of Brandenburg. {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Geographical features== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Civil registry offices == In 1905, these [[civil registry]] offices ({{lang-de|Standesamt}}) served the following towns in ''Kreis Schwerin in Posen'': ==Table of all communities== {| |'''Community''' |'''Polish spelling''' |'''1905 Pop''' |'''Polish''' |'''German''' |'''Jewish''' |'''Civil Ofc''' |'''Police Ofc''' |'''Court Ofc''' |- |} ==Table of office holders== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==External links== {{NavPosenDistricts}} {{coord missing|Greater Poland Voivodeship}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Schwerin in Posen, Kreis}} [[Category:Districts of Prussia]] [[Category:Former administrative regions of Greater Poland]] {{GreaterPoland-geo-stub}} {{Germany-hist-stub}}
